5.3.2 - Presence of Student Council and its activities for institutional development and student welfare
The University is committed to the student's overall personality
development and welfare and promotes a healthy atmosphere for them.
The university has an active Student Council known as the
“University Students Activity Council ” to groom students in extra-
curricular and co-curricular skills. The students of the University
are encouraged to take part in all the activities of the council to
inculcate cultural, literary, technical, and social betterment to
serve society and the Nation with the utmost professionalism,
ethics, and improved quality of life. The Dean of Students Welfare
is the Chairperson of USAC and is associated with the
Secretary/Deputy Secretary and Faculty Advisors nominated by the
Vice-Chancellor of the University. The 10 Sub-Councils are as
follows:
1. Sports Sub-Council
2. Cultural Sub-Council
3. Hobby Sub-Council
4. Literary Sub-Council
5. Photography Sub-Council
6. NSS Sub-Council
7. Yoga Sub-Council
8. Social and Print Media Sub-Council
9. Technical Sub-Council
10. NCC Sub-Council
The students of the University also participate in various inter-
university/ State / National level programs/ Competitions. The USAC
activities are funded from the fees collected by the students as
well as grants received from the Government or other agencies for
organizing the various activities and events.
